    Standard

Two dimension Gaussian kernel.

Source: R/GaussKernel.R
GaussKernel.Rd

Two dimension Gaussian kernel.

Arguments

sd.num

<numeric>: standard deviation parameter of the gaussian. (Default 1)

kernSize.num

<numeric>: size of kernel. If null size is 1+4*sd.num. (Default NULL)

scale.chr

<character>: scaling kind of box. If "1" sum of kernel equal 1. If "int" Minimal value of kernel is 1 and all entry are integer. If "none", kernel is not scale. (Default "1")

by.num

<numerical>: step size for compute Gaussian function in two dimension (Default 0.01).

Value

numerical matrix.

Details

GaussKernel

Examples

GaussKernel(scale.chr=c("none"))
#>             [,1]       [,2]       [,3]       [,4]        [,5]
#> [1,] 0.003687738 0.01467892 0.02323506 0.01467892 0.003687738
#> [2,] 0.014678925 0.05842899 0.09248640 0.05842899 0.014678925
#> [3,] 0.023235056 0.09248640 0.14639537 0.09248640 0.023235056
#> [4,] 0.014678925 0.05842899 0.09248640 0.05842899 0.014678925
#> [5,] 0.003687738 0.01467892 0.02323506 0.01467892 0.003687738
GaussKernel(scale.chr=c("1"))
#>            [,1]       [,2]       [,3]       [,4]       [,5]
#> [1,] 0.00378160 0.01505254 0.02382644 0.01505254 0.00378160
#> [2,] 0.01505254 0.05991614 0.09484038 0.05991614 0.01505254
#> [3,] 0.02382644 0.09484038 0.15012146 0.09484038 0.02382644
#> [4,] 0.01505254 0.05991614 0.09484038 0.05991614 0.01505254
#> [5,] 0.00378160 0.01505254 0.02382644 0.01505254 0.00378160
sum(GaussKernel(scale.chr=c("1")))
#> [1] 1
GaussKernel(scale.chr=c("int"))
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] [,5]
#> [1,]    1    4    7    4    1
#> [2,]    4   16   26   16    4
#> [3,]    7   26   40   26    7
#> [4,]    4   16   26   16    4
#> [5,]    1    4    7    4    1
